architectural_notes: WebRTC matchmaking depends on successful signaling + ICE candidate exchange; add TURN relay support (potentially TURN-only) to handle restrictive networks/double NAT.
known_issues: Users see "failed to match" when WebRTC handshake/ICE does not complete; likely missing TURN relay fallback in restrictive network conditions (e.g., double NAT).

existing_features.title: Update the WebRTC configuration so matchmaking voice calls use TURN-only (relay-only) ICE, forcing connections to be established via TURN relay instead of attempting direct P2P (host/srflx) candidates.

new_feature_requests.summary: Improve matchmaking reliability by enabling TURN relay fallback (TURN-only mode) to resolve "failed to match" WebRTC connection failures

projectName: Enable TURN-only mode to reduce WebRTC "failed to match" errors
